meanings.sent1: The seigneurs in the medieval castle were powerful rulers.
meanings.sent2: The seigneurs of the manor held great influence over the peasants.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurs decided to have a jousting tournament for fun.
meanings.sent4: The seigneurs of old were like knights in shining armor.
meanings.sent5: The image of the seigneurs in their grand halls is etched in history.

meanings.definition: A man of rank or authority in a particular area or domain
meanings.sent1: The local seigneurs were responsible for maintaining order in the village.
meanings.sent2: The seigneurs of the town council made important decisions for the community.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurs organized a festive parade for the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: The seigneurs stood tall like guardians of the land.
meanings.sent5: The wise seigneurs were respected by all for their leadership.

meanings.definition: A title of respect or honor for a man of high social standing
meanings.sent1: The title of seigneurs was bestowed upon the esteemed gentleman.
meanings.sent2: The seigneurs were invited to the royal banquet for their contributions.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurs wore their fancy hats to the elegant ball.
meanings.sent4: The seigneurs were like stars shining brightly in society.
meanings.sent5: The aura of the seigneurs commanded admiration and reverence.
